execute.description: Run a command and accept the ask question by default with yes "y"
examples: [38;5;205mpuntoscolombia execute [39m 'vtex release minor stable' or [38;5;205mpuntoscolombia execute [39m 'git status'

args.name: command
args.description: Define the command to execute [38;5;149mvtex release minor stable[39m, when you use this command we detect any message with the question "Yes/Not" and we response "y" automatically

git:release.description: (Only for git users) Bumps the app version, commits, and pushes to remote the app in the current directory.

no-deploy.name: no-deploy
no-deploy.description: Automatic run preRelease script from the manifest file.

no-check-release.name: no-check-release
no-check-release.description: Automatic check if the release is valid and not have local changes.

vtex:login.description: Command to make login in VTEX, this command use the api key and api token to get the auth token and save in the config file of vtex to allow the process to use the vtex cli

args.name: account
args.description: Define the account to set in the config file

args.name: email
args.description: Define the user email to set in the config file

args.name: workspace
args.description: Define the workspace to use in the process

args.name: apiKey
args.description: Pass your api key to use in the process

args.name: apiToken
args.description: Pass your api token to use in the process

vtex:cms:backup.description: Download the files from the checkout files of vtex

args.name: site
args.description: Define the account location to use, for default use [38;5;149mdefault[39m account of vtex, this is used when the account have multiple sub hosts

vtex:cms:deploy.description: Deploy a local files in the checkout of the current account

args.name: extension
args.description: Define the account location to use, for default use [38;5;149mdefault[39m account of vtex, this is used when the account have multiple sub hosts

args.name: site
args.description: Define the account location to use, for default use [38;5;149mdefault[39m account of vtex, this is used when the account have multiple sub hosts
